page.title: 10Local History
page.content: Changes in the last 80 years Mr.&Mrs.Harris have seen many changes to Great Ponton in their lifetime.They can remember there being several small businesses in the village including;a shoemaker;a carpenter;a wheelwright;a blacksmith ;and a mill and bakery.In 1919 Gt Ponton railway station was opened.The village had a school on the west side(built in 1717). Over the last 80 years all the small businesses have disappeared ,apart from the blacksmith.In the 1960s the A1 was made into a dual carriageway which changed the nature of the village.The school was moved from the west side into the centre of the village because of the traffic. A proposed road bridge,to avoid the isolation of the west side,has never been built.
